intro: Lessingia germanorum subsp. eutenuis, commonly known as the slender lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
